content.content: Screenshot (26)1264×289 205 KB  January had 13 out of 20 existing Core Units (19 of which have a Discourse account) published some kind of update covering their recent work done. In addition to regular updates, we have a Quarterly Report by GovAlpha, Financial Report by Real World Finance, monthly update by NewSilver, and December’s Actual Expenses vs Budget by Strategic Finance. Other updates include both the Delegate’s January Compensation and Round-up published by GovAlpha, as well as two proposals published by the MakerDAO Open Market Committee.  Shortlist     Core Unit Update Update Update Update     Collateral Engineering Services January 12 January 20     Data Insights January 18 January 26     Development and UX January 13      GovAlpha January 7 January 14 January 28 Quarterly Report   Governance Communications January 18 January 28     Growth January 14 January 22 January 28    Immunifi Security January Update      Real World Finance RWF-001 Auditor Flow Financial Report NewSilver    Risk January Update      StarkNet Engineering December Update January Update     Strategic Finance December: Actual Expenses vs Budget      Sustainable Ecosystem Scaling January 20 January 27     Sidestream Auction Services January 14 January 28          Other Update Update     Delegation January Compensation January Round-up   MOMC January 7 January 27      Comprehensive Assembly of Core Unit Updates (PDF)  You can find a more detailed assembly of all the Core Unit and Team updates shown above in this public PDF document.   Feedback We encourage anybody to drop their feedback for improvement to the Monthly Core Unit Updates Program. Forum: @Artem_Gordon Discord: ArtemGordon#0003 COM-001
Artem_Gordon:  12 out of 18 existing   Which CUs are not publishing updates? Dai Foundation and ?

So there are more than 18 existing Core Units (some also in RFC or onboarding); some Core Units don’t have a Discourse account, it seems like? Therefore, they can’t post anything. Here’s a list of CUs: GOV-001 COM-001 CES-001 DECO-001 DUX-001 IS-001 ORA-001 PE-001 SAS-001 SNE-001 SF-001 GRO-001 MDS-001 SH-001 SES-001 DAIF-001 DIN-001 RISK-001 RWF-001 TECH-001 But in terms of CUs that do have a Discourse account but haven’t posted CU/team updates are: Deco, Oracles, Risk, Strategic Happiness, TechOps, and Daif. They may post something very soon, but I want to get this publication out by the first week of Friday.

Artem_Gordon:  But in terms of CUs that do have a Discourse account but haven’t posted CU/team updates are: Deco, Oracles, Risk, Strategic Happiness, TechOps, and Daif.   @Artem_Gordon Risk CU has been posting monthly updates regularly since August 2021. See posts made by @Sean.

@Primoz @psychonaut @Sean Sean spoke with me and I truly apologize for missing your update. I remember that you guys usually do post monthly updates. I have edited the post as well as the PDF to now include your January update. Thank you for coming out to me and letting me know. It is always my intention to include everything that I can
Is there an update from the Protocol Engineering CU?
Hey, this is their most recent update post. It covers December but presents some Q1 and January foresight
Currently in progress - I should have it up by the end of the week!
Hi, sorry did not mean to pressure or anything, I just thought it was missing. Looking forward to it!
no no  no need to apologise, I’m overdue on it, so I am pleased to see that it is being sought out

TechOps Core Unit is responsible for supporting critical Maker infrastructure, maintaining its stability and operability with a 24/7/365 schedule. Incidents overview for September 2022 As usual, starting with the overview over the incidents that were opened and we’ve been working on in September. They are split on per service basis:  AWS infrastructure - 21 incidents EC2 instances - 71 incidents Etherscan - 1 incident Governance App - 2 incidents MongoDB - 7 incidents Nodes - 15 incidents On-Chain Governance - 9 incidents Oracles and Feeds - 22 incidents Vulcanize DB - 2 incidents  TOTAL 150 incidents All incidents are handled by the team with a 24/7/365 on-call schedule covering all time zones. Internal Community tickets This is a reminder that TechOps Core Unit has a channel on MakerDAO Discord server (#techops-requests) that is dedicated to Community, where anyone can open requests. 12 tickets were opened using that method. The Merge The biggest Ethereum event of September was The Merge. We were preparing for it a couple of months before it happened. There was a Discord channel created to coordinate all activities between core units related to the Merge. TechOps core unit team has been closely monitoring all the infrastructure. Overall everything went fine. We had to do a couple of last minute changes and node upgrades the day the Merge happened and resolve small infrastructure issues. No impact on any of the critical MakerDAO systems. Community tasks & Cross-core unit collaboration  GovAlpha  Updating Forum for Personal Data Protection Policy created by COM-001   PECU  Tracking and monitoring large MKR transfers  Chainlog - improving monitoring and checking deployment process   DUX CU  Preparing and provisioning infrastructure for Gasless Voting   Dai Foundation  Analysis and technical implementation of switching email providers Scamming site - reporting and taking down, creating process Ongoing Github maintenance - archiving repositories, creating repositories, user access   Growth:  Ongoing Twitter maintenance   Oracles:  Updating Feeds and Relayer monitors Provision Arbitrum and Optimism infrastructure Configure Feeds for L2 Provision and research infrastructure for L2 Oracles   GovComms:  Updating forum behaviour on when the posts can be updated Together with Immunefi CU - Ongoing security initiatives involving multiple CU members and Delegates   Misc. community:  Upgrading and monitoring Ethereum nodes, preparation for The Merge Infrastructure as Code refactoring including updating of external modules and providers Monitoring infrastructure maintenance Updating integration for creating tickets after Discord updates Whitelisting executive spells Discord maintenance, creating channels etc.    Please reach out if there are any questions. Also reminding everyone to leave any feedback to TechOps Core Unit Budget Proposal MIP for 2023.
This topic was automatically closed 90 days after the last reply. New replies are no longer allowed.

TechOps Core Unit is responsible for supporting critical Maker infrastructure, maintaining its stability and operability with a 24/7/365 schedule. We’re based in different regions to ensure global coverage. Incidents overview for October 2022 As usual, starting with the overview over the incidents that were opened and we’ve been working on in October 2022. They are split on per service basis:  Blog - 3 incidents Ecosystem Analytics - 1 incident EC2 - 16 incidents Governance App - 2 incidents Nodes - 13 incidents Oracles and Feeds - 51 incidents Poke Keeper - 4 incidents Vulcanize DB - 40 incidents  TOTAL - 130 incidents All incidents are picked up and worked on by the team with a 24/7/365 on-call schedule covering all time zones. Internal Community tickets We have a channel on MakerDAO Discord server (#techops-requests) that is dedicated to Community members to give requests for TechOps team. We encourage everyone to use it. In October 2022 there were 20 tickets opened via that channel. A steady increase since the channel has been created (12 tickets last month). Community tasks & Cross-core unit collaboration  Oracles  Provision and troubleshoot Arbitrum and Optimism nodes Updating Feeds to support L2 Layer 2 services for L2 Oracle support   Community  Forum - doing upgrades, allowing to embed document in the iframe, fixing group messaging bug Discord management - cleanup, adding/removing users, adjusting permissions, read-only channel category, banning spam users   PECU  Whitelisting the weekly executive spells Create zero vote alarm monitoring Adding new collaterals, monitoring, analytics data and alerts for them Update autoline-watcher to track updated ILKs Adding new keepers   Dai Foundation  GitHub management - moving repositories, adjusting permissions, changing visibility. Creating a process around reporting and taking down the scammer website   GovComms  Onboarding/offboarding people - creating process   DUX  Provisioning new infrastructure, CICD, testing and monitoring of the gasless voting feature   Internal  Cleanup of the infrastructure related to old Auctions UI, removing monitoring We went through the security audit and several findings were reported. We’re working to mitigate them Documenting steps on how to update monitoring tests after user interface changes are released for various projects (Blog, Forum, Governance App, makerdao.com, etc.) Documenting MegaPoker steps to mitigate alerts Documenting VDB alarms Add example code for TF cloud modules Add ability to create urgent requests for TechOps team Kubernetes cluster’s code improvements Upgrade deprecated Lambda runtime Upgrade Erigon nodes Improve the blockchain monitoring Lambda 2023 New Budget preparation and submission    Please reach out if you have any questions.

2087×252 174 KB  The Monthly Core Unit Updates are published with the intention of improving accessibility and gathering forum information on MakerDAO-related recurring updates.  Summary This thread is updated weekly to include the most recent and relevant Core Unit and Team updates covering the work done for July 2022. A similar thread that covers Core Unit and Team work done for August 2022 is available here.  Last month, nearly all Core Units posted an update on their work and progress. We also broke a record regarding the total number of updates posted within a month. These metrics help represent the transparency and communication each Core Unit provides for the DAO.  1219×500 2.93 KB  The graph above compares the number of active Core Units (yellow), Core Unit updates (purple), and updates that fall within Core Unit mandates and domains but are not necessarily posted as Core Unit updates (teal). Since January 2022, the number of monthly updates has approximately doubled. Core Units are not only providing monthly updates on their work and progress, but some are also doing so on a weekly cadence. In addition, Core Units continue to organize their initiatives and subteams, which leads to a greater number of Other Updates, such as RWAs, Brand, Governance, Finance, and other initiatives-based updates. I’m excited to see the final numbers for July 2022. TechOps Core Unit was formed in the beginning of February after an executive vote passed. I would like to give an update of what we have been working on during the first month of operation. Want to remind that the Core Unit’s main focus is ensuring Maker’s critical infrastructure and ecosystem stability and operability. We continue to monitor over 200 different parts of the system, parameters, servers, market deviations, etc. In February the team received alerts that can be grouped into these services:   AWS infrastructure - 6 incidents  Blog - 1 incident  Coinmarketcap integration - 1 incident  EC2 - 7 incidents  Etherscan integration - 2 incidents  Marketing Website - 2 incidents  MongoDB - 12 incidents  Nodes - 3 incidents  On-Chain Governance - 10 incidents  Oracles and Feeds - 9 incidents  Poke Keeper - 2 incidents  Test templates - 3 incidents  TFI - 1 incident  Vulcanize DB - 7 incidents  67 incidents in total. All incidents are taken care of instantly or close to instantly (depending on their priority) and the necessary actions are taken in order to fix the root causes. Sometimes these actions require cross Core Unit collaboration. Independent work  We successfully migrated all the tools and services from the Maker Foundation accounts to the new TechOps Core Unit accounts and are now exclusively using our Core Unit budget to control, pay and monitor all the tools necessary for operations. We are constantly monitoring and optimising our AWS cloud costs. In the past month we researched and implemented a Compute Savings Plan and converted all of our storage volumes from GP2 to a newer, more robust and cost efficient GP3 format. Ongoing work regarding setting up a new entity to efficiently work with a DAO. This includes sourcing quality legal, accounting and human resources. We are continuing to work with SES CU mainly around their budget reporting framework. You can see our monthly Budget Statements.  Collaboration with the Community  We have done necessary updates to Discord slash commands. If you didn’t know, anyone can use Discord slash commands to get some useful information. Just type / in the message field and you will be prompted a list of possible commands. Discord user ban bot has been updated and some settings have been improved Forum has been upgraded to the latest version and some extra plugins added. Besides that we try to perform daily updates to have the latest security fixes deployed in Production. Notifications about MKR liquidity and On-Chain Governance Hat updates have been implemented and added to #bot-feed Discord channel available to all Community.  Cross-Core Unit collaboration  Together with Gov Alpha CU helping with onboarding new Core Unit members to all internal systems. Build notification system for the Dai Foundation Core Unit informing about GitHub changes Build online parser of assets that belong to the Dai Foundation Together with Governance Communication and Immunify Core Units working on onboarding more teams/CUs to the internal alerting system. For Protocol Engineering Core Unit created 2 Dockerfiles for running the UI and logger.py with Docker, a docker-compose.yml to run these locally for testing, and deployed these 2 chainlog components in AWS.  Work in progress There are some tasks in progress that we are working on and want to share of what you can expect soon:  During our CU launch Pod Session we’ve been asked about our CU roadmap and plans. We are working on creating a roadmap, formalising it and making it available to all Community. We plan to convert some internal notifications about ecosystem parameters to become public and available to the Community. Improving public Maker ecosystem statuspage, integrating and automating it with internal monitoring system.  Let me know if there are any questions to the above.

TechOps Core Unit main area of responsibility didn’t change. We’re still giving top priority to Maker’s critical infrastructure, as well as ecosystem stability and operability. Below you can read our March 2022 updates. New hires Our core unit team is growing and we are happy to welcome two new hires:  Artautas who is our new project manager and is already helping us structure the processes, finances and structure our work better in terms of defining priorities. Nick is our new DevOps engineer. And we are very excited to have him. Nick is already helping us with several engineering projects. More to come.  Expanding the team is always great. That means we can deliver more, do it faster and better. Incidents overview for March 2022 TechOps core unit is always on-call. Team members are distributed over the globe. We’re online 24/7 with no holidays and breaks, looking after the Maker Ecosystem. Below is the list of the incidents that were triggered during March 2022 split into services:  AWS infrastructure - 34 incidents Blog - 3 incidents Governance App - 5 incidents EC2 - 6 incidents Etherscan - 4 incidents MongoDB - 4 incidents On-Chain Governance - 16 incidents Oracles and Feeds - 12 incidents Poke Keeper - 2 incidents Vulcanize DB - 12 incidents  TOTAL - 98 incidents You might wonder why there are so many AWS Infrastructure incidents that we receive. The answer is simple. Most of the infrastructure that many projects are based on is marked with this name and goes under AWS infrastructure incidents. If we dig more, there were multiple projects’ infrastructure that had issues. But nothing to worry about, TechOps took care of everything. Community work We created several things that affect the Community. In case you missed them, they are:  We have a new Discord bot deployed to MakerDAO Official Discord server that blocks specific username patterns that tend to be used to trick and mislead our Community users. Hopefully that reduces the amount of spam and protects our Community more. A new channel called forum-notifications has been created on MakerDAO Official Discord server. We configured it in a way that all new topics created on Forum generate a notification that is sent to that channel. This is to create awareness about new things that are being discussed on Forum. Let us know what you think! Ownership of some specific plugins that are used on our Community Forum has been transferred to TechOps. Now we are responsible for deploying, updating and maintaining them. The same technical work that we are already doing with the Forum. Many support requests to onboard/offboard people, give access rights, create accounts, help with forum and other tools, check permissions, help with calendars, provide some information from random documents or systems, upgrade accounts, etc.  Technical work   MakerDAO legacy APIs (Vulcanize DB) - we planned to decommission old MakerDAO APIs and verified where it is used. Since we discovered that it is still used in a couple of critical places, we decided to continue maintaining and supporting it. We will continue looking for some permanent solutions for replacing it.   We upgraded geth nodes that we currently support to the latest versions and also prepared for The Merge.   Did update MakerDAO Statuspage, linked all its parts to automated tests that we are running. That means the fails in monitoring tests will automatically update status on that page. A separate forum topic about that update will be created soon.   Optimized AWS costs by moving some legacy projects out of the account that we are maintaining.   Provisioned two L2 infrastructure nodes - Optimism and Arbitrum in preparation for L2.   Finances  We completed our first month of operations budget reporting. Second month of operations - March is available now too.  Collaboration with other teams  Dai Foundation Core Unit - helping with the flow for managing all Dai Foundation assets, a process for requesting updates, getting approvals, etc. Growth Core Unit - helping the team with getting some analytics data. PE CU - continuing to work on provisioning L2 nodes and L2 smart contracts monitoring. Some good progress has been made. DUX Core Unit - collaborating with the core unit, helping with creating monitoring tests, working on expanding them, as well as including them into deployment flow. That will help with stability of the backend and frontend parts of the Governance App - the main DUX CU project, on-chain governance and overall voting process user experience. Data Analytics Core unit - helped updating liquidation-monitor lambda to use new API endpoint.  Tasks in progress  We are establishing content managers for Website, Forum and Blog and planning to add a clause to them that describes TechOps team responsibilities’ boundaries for these three systems. More will be communicated when this is done.

dumitru:  TOTAL - 98 incidents   Out of these, good to hear that AWS infrastructure incidents are not a big threat but curious, were there any significant threats that were mitigated? I believe there were some few that required executive votes but not sure whether they fall under this category. Thank you for securing the protocol

Hi @Doo_StableLab Thanks for asking. I checked incident statistics for the last month and AWS Infrastructure incidents were mainly related to:  anomaliusly high access requests coming to specific servers and server ports (medium priority) Server utilization parameters being above normal threshold (CPU, disc, etc.) (medium priority) Notifying about blocked access to the servers (low priority) Log errors in the wallet responsible for refilling multiple wallets integrated in different parts of the systems like Oracles, Feeds, etc. (high priority)  If you want to know what were the most critical incidents that happened in March, it is those related to Poke Keeper and Oracles and Feeds. Late poking and troubles with Oracles and Feeds could have bad consequences resulting in collateral prices not being updated. And that puts users at risk and opened vaults at risk of undesired liquidation. Sometimes On-Chain Governance service incidents could be quite impactful. I checked those that were triggered in March and most of them were informative. So luckily nothing too bad. Let me know if that answers your question. Otherwise I can provide even more details if needed.

dumitru:  If you want to know what were the most critical incidents that happened in March, it is those related to Poke Keeper and Oracles and Feeds. Late poking and troubles with Oracles and Feeds could have bad consequences resulting in collateral prices not being updated. And that puts users at risk and opened vaults at risk of undesired liquidation.   Is this a problem with keepers or the oracles themselves? What was the fix and how is it being prevented from happening?

That was neither a problem with Oracles, nor with Feeds. It happened due to a sudden gas price spike right after Poke Keeper transaction was initiated. And while doing automatic retry, gas needed was above available threshold. We immediately poked manually. And as a fix, we implemented a new logic for automatic retry as well as modified threshold limits for certain cases. I do not want to go into deep technical details in public to prevent targeted attacks. But there were multiple improvements implemented in the Poke Keeper logic that automated all processes for many real-life cases, including market growth, crashes, changes in gas prices, multiple retries logic. Everything above is done with the aim of having optimal gas costs to save the costs. If we compare to how the system worked 1 year ago, it is much more independent, secure and advanced now, almost never requiring human interaction.

TechOps Core Unit continues to support critical Maker infrastructure, maintaining its stability and operability with a 24/7/365 schedule. Below you can find what TechOps Core Unit team has been working on in July 2022. Incidents overview for July 2022 July 2022 was another month with crypto market instability. A number of incidents were related to that. Here is an overview of all incidents that TechOps Core Unit has received and been working on during the month:  AWS infrastructure - 20 incidents Governance App - 9 incidents EC2 instances - 10 incidents Etherscan integration - 3 incidents MongoDB - 13 incidents Nodes - 5 incidents On-Chain Governance - 9 incidents Oracles and Feeds - 27 incidents Oracle Security Module - 3 incidents Poke Keeper - 4 incidents Vulcanize DB - 3 incidents  TOTAL - 106 incidents Community tickets Since last month we introduced a new way how Community members can submit support tickets to TechOps Core Unit. It can be done directly from MakerDAO Official Discord in the #techops-requests channel by typing requests using specific format. Check the channel out to see how to do it. In July we had 8 tickets opened through the above-mentioned Discord channel. Community and cross-core units tasks  Multiple support requests for Discord groups, users, messages, etc. Install & Enable Discourse-Math plugin for prod and staging forum GitHub management and changing repositories visibility Performing regular forum upgrades, requests to install forum plugins Getting forum posts in batch, creating backups Increasing monitoring and test coverage for delegate/migration page flows Updating and optimizing costs infra for Governance App Upgrade RDS postgres database used by DUX core unit Provision a dedicated Ubuntu server running Docker for gasless voting development  Technical tasks  Collateral offboarding - Performed technical work to offboard collaterals. We’re attending weekly collateral status meetings and based on all discussions and activities planned in those meetings, we’re performing updates in the monitoring, alerting systems to always match collateral types currently supported by the ecosystem Performed upgrades of RDS PostgresQL databases for Auctions and VulcanizeDB services Deprecated OpenEthereum nodes that were previously used in the infrastructure Performing regular Geth upgrades and switching some internal services to Geth nodes due to the above deprecation Reviewed Lambda monitoring functions, made a plan and started doing upgrades where necessary Performed preparations, configuration and monitoring of Ethereum test network’s Goerli Merge Getting ready for Mainnet Merge next month Continuing to work with PECU deploying and operating support services for L2 Teleport on Optimism Started closely working with Starknet Engineering Core Unit around L2 Teleport on Starknet Had an initial meeting with DUX CU regarding their “Gasless voting” project and the infrastructure required there Adding support in Chainlog, for the json files that are generated by logger.py to be pushed back to the GitHub repository.

Lastly, we’re always available for inquiries on the MakerDAO Discord or on our DUX Discord server.   tl;dr Last month we had our second offsit…

TechOps Core Unit is as usual responsible for critical Maker infrastructure, maintaining its stability and operability. Below you can find the tasks that we’ve been working on in May. Incidents overview for May 2022 Many of the below incidents are due to the fact that the market situation in May has been unstable with multiple network parameters, collateral prices, etc. changing very fast in short periods of time. All incidents have been taken care of instantly by the team members.  AWS infrastructure - 5 incidents EC2 - 36 incidents Governance App - 2 incidents Nodes - 19 incidents Oracle Security Module - 10 incidents Oracle Security Module (pending transactions) - 4 incidents Oracles and Feeds - 96 incidents Poke Keeper - 3 incidents Vulcanize DB - 6 incidents  TOTAL - 181 incidents Community work  Discord - cleaning, banning, adding filters - configuring bots to prevent spam Community Zoom account configuration Integrating Google Analytics with Discourse Maker Community Forum  Technical tasks  Oracles, infrastructure and monitoring maintenance during the periods of gas prices spikes Updating infrastructure, monitoring and analytics data with new collateral tokens Improving the monitoring of Oracles infrastructure Integrating decentralised Forta monitoring with Maker protocol monitoring infrastructure and TechOps alerting setup. The goal is to have an additional monitoring suite that verifies critical ecosystem parameters. Updating makerdao.com website with extra links, redirects, etc. Adding new MegaPoker address Reviewing Vulcanize DB AWS Lambdas, decommissioning unnecessary components and upgrading others. Adding additional monitoring.  Helping other Core Units  DUX CU - Creating monitoring for auctions and migration portal Oracles CU - Getting new collateral prices from CMC and switching from Coingecko due to Terra and UST incident. Oracles CU - Replacing Coinmarketcap deprecated endpoint Protocol Engineering CU - Deploying Teleport keeper, monitoring and setting up Continuous Integration Protocol Engineering CU - Developing Teleport L2 keepers Dai Foundation - Some work on updating Dai Foundation domains, assets, setting redirects and other technical setup for the domains Dai Foundation - Claiming airdrop tokens that belong to the Dai Foundation.

I didn’t know that RWA and sourcecreed was a kind of central unit. Or what would be their exact category?
Is there any information on the number of people are employed by the DAO?  I had no idea there were 17 different Core Units, this is a great overview.

Don’t know if there’s something better but here’s a link to all the CU budgets which should each describe headcount.  Also note that you get a description of all CUs in MIP39. https://mips.makerdao.com/mips/details/MIP38#MIP38c2

FYI:  I personally hate to have ‘click’ to see type dropdown lists when the breakouts were not ‘that long’ and easy to scan provided the formatting (section header) and the contents is reasonable. Please, please lets try to avoid documents with drop downs as they are a waste of time and only contribute to increased likelihood of carpal tunnel in most people.
Sure, thanks for being honest and letting me know. Feel free to drop any opinions in the future that you think will help your QoL around these publications

Initially, I had RWAs under RWF but I split them out into an “Other” category now that they are growing in numbers and aren’t directly tied to RWF. SourceCred updates are similar to Delegation updates where it’s reviewing a collection of unique people taking action on something and/or getting compensated/paid for that action.
Hey! @thomas.flitter may have this number. He helps to keep track of data like that
I love this format, very novel the theme of the lists, excellent work Artem
Thanks! What are your thoughts on the dropdown? Too much?
Maybe in the others section you can vary the style . Otherwise it is useful to contain so much info
The dropdowns are incredibly helpful in the other forum recaps but mostly not needed here for 1-line updates of links. Otherwise, I appreciate all of the new summaries of updates!
Personally, I don’t mind a dropdown if it can be used as an option.

@MightyOx @MFeinberg Thanks. One of the reasons I used them here is to see if anybody says anything and gauge an overall sentiment, which seems to be working great actually. This gives me an idea of what a good middle ground would be.
I think it’s likely more of a subjective thing for each person as to if they like it or not.  It really makes no difference to me.

TechOps Core Unit mandate is still valid and remains unchanged. We are here to support critical Maker infrastructure, maintaining its stability and operability with a 24/7/365 schedule. We continue to run infrastructure, services and monitoring to ensure ecosystem stability and health. The team is based in different regions to ensure global coverage.  Incidents overview for December 2022 As usual, we start with the overview of the incidents that were opened and we’ve been working on in December 2022. Totally we are monitoring 41 different services. Below are the services that had incidents triggered last month:  Analytics dashboard - 1 incidents AWS infrastructure - 13 incidents EC2 - 25 incidents Etherscan integration - 28 incidents Forum - 3 incidents Governance App - 3 incidents Nodes - 88 incidents Oracles and Feeds - 1 incident Oracle Security Module - 7 incidents Vulcanize DB - 15 incidents  TOTAL - 184 incidents Incidents have one of three priorities, where P1 is the highest priority requiring immediate attention and P3 is the lowest priority that doesn’t require quick response.  Internal Community tickets There is a channel (#techops-requests) on the Community Discord server that has been created for Community to give requests to TechOps Core Unit. In December there were 13 tickets created using that channel.  Community tasks & Cross-core unit collaboration  Community  Forum - changing some settings related to embedding third-party websites in frames Forum - partial outage, working on fixes and infrastructural changes  Forum - whitelisting server IP addresses Discord - adding/removing people, changes in roles Discord - upgrading spam bot settings Discord - creating and configuring two token-gated channels  Whitelisting executive spells in the monitoring system Offboarding core unit user from all community tools Zoom - changes to account setup   Internal @techops-core-unit  Adding GNO and rETH collaterals to monitoring systems, creating analytics dashboards, etc. Upgrading relayers, lambdas and alarms for new collaterals. Adding GNO and rETH collaterals to Vulcanize DB Doing improvements to analytics dashboards Completeness checker errors for VDB Adding secrets to various repositories Creating new VPN accounts Nodes - Fixing issues with Optimism1 node Nodes - Check why Geth0 node is freezing Updated Lair instance    @daif-core-unit  Transferring makerdao.world domain to the Dai Foundation, changing corresponding settings Twitter - taking over MakerDUX Twitter account and configuring DUX CU delegate access YouTube - Changing permissions for YouTube account Reporting and taking down 3 scam websites Moving makerdao.com to new email provider, adding ability to create new email addresses and giving option to request access to email groups. Note - it has to be requested from the Dai Foundation first. Removed outdated Feeds page from makerdao.com and other projects that referenced it Removed old Game project page and all references from it on makerdao.com  Configuring email groups  Creating scams directory public page and providing live status updates Created integration that monitors forum for new intangible assets requests and notifies Dai Foundation about that Configuring and making some bug fixes related to GitHub CLA tool    @dux-core-unit  Stopped old databases Gasless voting - created automated monitoring tests to submit gasless vote via API RDS and some work on environments    @GovAlpha-Core-Unit  Set up a server for the sourceCred instance and GovAlpha bots    @Oracles-Core-Unit  Updating oracle feeds, relayers    @Protocol-Engineering  Dashboard to show average Keeper “speed” in Maker Keeper Enhance functionality of Maker Keeper    @starknet-core-unit  Creating Teleport keeper on Goerli network Deploy mainnet Teleport keeper    And besides all the tasks mentioned above, we were working on multiple incidents that have been mentioned in the Incidents Overview section.  Reminder that every last Friday at 14:30 UTC TechOps Core Unit will be hosting open office hours for Maker Community. Everybody is welcome!

TechOps Core Unit is as usual responsible for critical Maker infrastructure, maintaining its stability and operability. I’m happy to present what TechOps Core Unit team has been working on in June. Incidents overview for June 2022 June 2022 was a month that was marked with crypto market instability and resulted in a number of incidents related to that. Here is an overview of all incidents that TechOps Core Unit has received and been working on during the month:  AWS Infrastructure - 21 incidents Coinmarketcap - 2 incidents Ecosystem websites - 3 incidents EC2 - 26 incidents Etherscan - 3 incidents Governance App - 25 incidents MongoDB - 5 incidents Nodes - 17 incidents On-Chain Governance - 9 incidents Oracle Security Module (pending transactions) - 2 incidents Oracles and Feeds - 44 incidents Poke Keeper - 1 incident Vulcanize DB - 3 incidents  TOTAL - 161 incidents Community work  We’ve been getting multiple requests from Community and to better structure a way to receive them and not miss anything, we created a Discord bot that is monitoring #techops-requests channel in the MakerDAO server and creates support tickets for us to prioritise and sort. Discord maintenance and support - ongoing battle with banning scammers and spammers and improving automated ways to do this for us Numerous support tickets related to changing settings, giving access to various community tools that are maintained by TechOps  Technical tasks  Upgrading Oracle relayers, monitors and Grafana analytics dashboards in regards to ecosystem changes Debugging, verifying and improving Chief Keeper stability Fixed Liquidation Monitor and Vaults Watcher Lambdas Onboarded 2 new collaterals Checking and debugging Node Watcher Lambda Upgrading Geth nodes to version 1.20.18 and then 1.20.19 in preparation for Ethereum fork Terminated old supporting SAI nodes Whitelisting executive spells in the monitoring workflow  Helping other Core Units  Protocol Engineering Core Unit - Improvements and ongoing work withTeleport monitoring Protocol Engineering Core Unit - Collaborating on including PECU to existing TechOps alerting and notification system as well as expanding its coverage to PECU specific areas Gov Comms Core Unit - Prepared PagerDuty (alerting and notification system) onboarding document and demo Dai Foundation - Doing updates to Digital assets copy, some technical work for setting up new domains and redirects DUX Core Unit - Improving monitoring, knowledge sharing, QA process, adding new tests Maker Growth Core Unit - Setting up and providing technical support during the first Maker Twitter Spaces event Maker Growth Core Unit - Some technical work for setting up new subdomains and changing DNS records to existing subdomains owned by the Dai Foundation

TechOps Core Unit is responsible for supporting critical Maker infrastructure, maintaining its stability and operability with a 24/7/365 schedule. We had two new starters in August - @SashaTsurenko and @santiago . We are very happy that they joined and already are helping us with many important tasks. Incidents overview for August 2022 Here is an overview of all incidents that TechOps Core Unit has received and been working on during the month:  Auctions Frontend - 1 incident AWS infrastructure - 1 incident Ecosystem websites - 1 incident EC2 - 11 incidents Governance App - 1 incident Nodes - 8 incidents Oracles and Feeds - 10 incidents Poke Keeper - 2 incidents Vulcanize DB - 4 incidents  TOTAL - 39 incidents On-call schedule is set for the whole team to have 24/7 coverage so that critical incidents are addressed instantly. Community tickets This is to remind that we have a channel on MakerDAO Official Discord channel (#techops-requests) that can be used for Community members requesting various tasks by using specific message format. It opens a ticket in our management board and we start processing it as soon as possible. Last month 14 tickets were opened via that discord channel. We encourage everyone to use it when needed. Community and cross-core units tasks  Whitelisting the spells Discord - creating/deleting channels, adding/removing people, updating spam rules, etc. Forum - regular upgrades, adding various plugins Ecosystem websites - updating DNS records for websites Getting a list of discord users that belong to all core units Updates done to the chainlog, changing API paths and historical data Keeping Dai Foundation assets list up to date, ENS domain renewals Updating SPF records for makerdao.com  Providing DF with the costs breakdown for all domains owned by it Helping with debugging CI for gov-polling-db Setting up infrastructure for gasless voting on Governance Portal Created and set up alerts for delegate contract activity Started collaborating with Starknet CU, helping them with setting up infrastructure, monitoring, CI process and creating keepers for watching various events. Preparing for the Merge - getting a list of monitoring services, creating Discord channel, inviting and onboarding people in PagerDuty (alerting tool), etc. During Merge - closely monitor the whole ecosystem during The Merge  Technical tasks  Upgrading Erigon nodes Provision mainnet beacon on Erigon1 Improving security of Maker AWS accounts (restricting access to some parts of the system, updating security groups) Installing prometheus agent on Erigon Spinning up L2 nodes Installing and configuring Lair instances for L2 for Oracles Updating feeds Adding MKR transfer monitoring (>1K MKR) Adding L2 keepers Delegate monitoring for DUX Improving infrastructure deployment process through Terraform Cloud Updating travis integration rules in some repositories Vulcanize upgrades for The Merge ( api ) Discord bot updates for CU list and psm links Starknet Bridge monitoring

TechOps Core Unit main areas of responsibilities are still the same - support Maker’s critical infrastructure, maintain its stability and operability. Below you can read our updates and things we’ve been working on in April 2022. New hires Last month we posted that two new people joined the team - Nik (DevOps Engineer) and Artautas (Project Manager). Both guys are doing great and already making a big impact on the team’s productivity. We are looking to hire two more DevOps Engineers. If you know anyone who would be interested, please find the job description here or find us on Discord. Incidents overview for April 2022 First of all, as always, we would like to give an overview over alerts that we received during the month, split by the services.  Analytics tool - 3 incidents AWS infrastructure - 9 incidents EC2 - 20 incidents Ecosystem websites - 4 incidents Etherscan - 6 incidents Governance App - 16 incidents MongoDB - 1 incident Nodes - 6 incidents On-Chain Governance - 18 incidents Oracles and Feeds - 44 incidents (mainly due to instability of the markets) Data Insights CU Nodes - 1 incident Vulcanize DB - 10 incidents  TOTAL - 138 incidents TechOps Core Unit follows a 24/7 on-call schedule, so there are always team members available to mitigate critical risks. Community work It is our responsibility to support the Maker Community and process all incoming requests. Below is the list of the things we did specifically for the Community:  Various support tickets that come through Discord Onboarding various new members across the community to the Maker infrastructure Upgrading Community Forum, forum plugins, executing multiple forum requests Added filtering usernames and junk words in messages to MakerDAO Official Discord server (new and better way than previously)  Technical work  Technical work related to new collaterals that have been added to the system, deploying new MegaPoker, updating monitoring and analytics tools related to new collaterals. Improving Oracles Security Module alerts monitoring Upgraded Ethereum (Geth, OpenEthereum) nodes that are run and maintained by our core unit to the latest versions. Improving nodes monitoring system Improving analytics data that monitors ecosystem Stood up Optimism and Arbitrum nodes for any future need when it comes to querying L2. Migrated the Postgres engine version for sai-mainnet database, including new DB Parameter Group for the new version; also stopped some of the sai-mainnet nodes that were no longer needed.  Collaboration with other teams and cross core unit work  Worked with Protocol Engineering Core Unit and Oracles Core Unit on mitigation of various security issues Working with Protocol Engineering Core Unit and Immunify Core Unit to monitor future Maker Teleport release. Together with Dai Foundation Core Unit Introduced new assets update request process.

1727×390 226 KB  The Monthly Core Unit Updates are published with the intent to improve accessibility and aggregate forum information containing all MakerDAO-related recurring updates.  Summary  April contained sixteen Core Units that published an update. Several new types of recurring updates are available by the CES, GovAlpha, GovComms, Real-World Finance, Strategic Finance, and SES Core Units:  CES presents their new Collateral Status Index and its updates.  GovAlpha presents a macro Governance report reviewing major DeFi and DAO governance systems across the Ethereum ecosystem. Governance Communications changed their Core Unit updates to a monthly cadence and introduced their first Stakeholder Content quarterly review and update.  Real-World Finance presents weekly updates on their Incubating Legal & Transactional Services.. Additionally, there is a total of at least nine updates and reports for onboarded collateral assets such as 6S Capital, New Silver, Harbor Trade, ConsolFreight, and the newly greenlit Huntingdon Valley Bank; found below.  StarkNet announces a few updates concerning the StarkNet Simple Bridge launch date.  Strategic Finance presents an analysis of Ethereum lending markets as well as their monthly Asset and Liability Management update. Additionally, the MakerDAO Actual Expenses vs. Budget and Financial Report are for April. Chaos Labs, joined with the SES Core Unit, published their very first update.   There are at least 45 updates in total for April, which encompass Core Unit progress, DAO and market analysis, financial reports, and more! This topic was automatically closed 14 days after the last reply. New replies are no longer allowed.

TechOps Core Unit mandate remains unchanged and is to support critical Maker infrastructure, maintaining its stability and operability with a 24/7/365 schedule. We continue to run infrastructure, services and monitoring to ensure ecosystem stability and health. The team is based in different regions to ensure global coverage. Incidents overview for November 2022 As usual, starting with the overview over the incidents that were opened and we’ve been working on in November 2022, split on per service basis:  AWS infrastructure - 6 incidents Blog - 4 incidents EC2 - 36 incidents Etherscan - 15 incidents Governance App - 36 incidents Grafana - 20 incidents MongoDB - 18 incidents Nodes - 90 incidents On-Chain Governance - 11 incidents Oracle Security Module - 11 incidents Oracles and Feeds - 4 incidents Vulcanize DB - 1 incident  TOTAL - 252 incidents We configured all incidents to automatically assign one of three priorities based on severity of the incident, where:   Priority 1 incidents - are picked up instantly by on-call team members (in practice it’s immediate response)  Priority 2 incidents - have maximum 6 hours response time (in practice it stays below 1 hour)  Priority 3 incidents - have maximum 24 hours response time (in practice it’s 6-18 hours)  Internal Community tickets Couple of months ago we created a channel on MakerDAO Discord server (#techops-requests) that is dedicated to Community members to give requests for TechOps team. We encourage everyone to use it. In November 2022 there were 20 tickets opened via that channel. People send us feedback that they want to know ticket status. We listened and are testing live updates that will be sent to the channel whenever a ticket is picked up by the team member and when the work on the ticket is completed. Stay connected and soon you will see the update in the channel. Community tasks & Cross-core unit collaboration  Community  Discord - adding users to channels. Offboarding users, cleanup offboarded channels Forum - investigation, troubleshooting and fix implementation relating to Forum not being accessible reported by one specific user Adding new slash command to Discord with extra link to PSM UI   Internal @techops-core-unit  Deal with rejected 2023 budget fall out Update node alerts Lambda function Check node block alarm Upgrade Lighthouse, Teku and Prysm nodes Check Arbitrum and Optimism disk alarms Optimize Liquidation Monitor Audit findings fix - Remove some potentially sensitive data stored in logs Audit findings fix - Enable Auto Minor version upgrade for RDS Audit findings fix - Improve Networks segmentation   Oracles CU @Oracles-Core-Unit  Remove configs and restart relayers Review Arbitrum nodes infrastructure Monitor ETH balances for relayers New collateral - rETH update Alarms, Monitors and Libs for rETH Ongoing work around Optimism nodes, their high availability, fast failure recovery and their monitoring. Optimism nodes have been very unstable.   Dai Foundation @daif-core-unit  Reviewing GitHub repositories, changing visibility, adding users to repos, changing access rights GitHub - users and outside collaborators cleanup Scammer sites - taking down    makerdao.com - fixing the automatic deployment of code changes and removing the Feeds references PECU CU @Protocol-Engineering  Whitelisting the spells Deploy Goerli Teleport Monitor Chainlog - created staging deployment Created real time dashboard for Keeper Gas costs   Immunefi CU @immunefi-core-unit  DNS change for is.makerdao.network DoS and Rate Limit bypass on polling-db   DUX CU @dux-core-unit  Decommission old Spock infrastructure instances Set up CI using Docker Compose file Assist with Gov Polling DB set up for production staging and Goerli environments for Gasless Voting launch Create tests+monitoring for relayers and keepers    We are also looking for feedback regarding our updated budget proposal. Feel free to contact us with questions if you have any.
